result.reason: PuTTY embedded window hangs on auth failure because interactive password retry dialogs block in child-window mode; adding -batch flag when credentials are supplied makes PuTTY exit immediately on failure instead of prompting
result.approach: When SSH credentials are provided via -pw/-pwfile, also pass the PuTTY -batch flag to disable interactive auth prompts — PuTTY will exit with non-zero code on failure, which ProcessExited already handles by prompting to update the stored password

attempts.raw_output:
Based on my analysis of the SSH connection code in `PuttyBase.cs`, the issue is clear: when PuTTY is embedded as a child window and receives wrong credentials, it shows interactive authentication retry dialogs that can't be properly interacted with in embedded mode, causing the app to appear hung. The `ProcessExited` handler (line 69-92) already handles the case where PuTTY *exits* with an error, but the hang occurs because PuTTY *doesn't exit* — it waits for interactive input.

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"PuTTY embedded window hangs on auth failure because interactive password retry dialogs block in child-window mode; adding -batch flag when credentials are supplied makes PuTTY exit immediately on failure instead of prompting","priority":"P2-bug","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/PuttyBase.cs"],"approach":"When SSH credentials are provided via -pw/-pwfile, also pass the PuTTY -batch flag to disable interactive auth prompts — PuTTY will exit with non-zero code on failure, which ProcessExited already handles by prompting to update the stored password"}
```
